    • Constructor Detail

      • FunctionTree

        public FunctionTree(Function f)
        Creates a new function tree
        Parameters:
        f - The function to act as the root of the tree

      • FunctionTree

        public FunctionTree(Function... functions)
        Creates a new function tree, by specifying the root and its immediate children
        Parameters:
        functions - An array of functions. The first element of the array is the function to act as the root of the tree. The size of the array must be n+1, where n is the input arity of that function. The remaining elements of the array are the functions that will be the children of the root in the resulting tree.

    • Method Detail

        f - The function
        Returns:

      • evaluate

        public Object[] evaluate(Object[] inputs,
                Context context)
        Description copied from class: Function
        Evaluates the outputs of the function, given some inputs
        Specified by:
        evaluate in class Function
        Parameters:
        inputs - The arguments of the function. The size of the array should be equal to the function's declared input arity.
        context - The context in which the evaluation is done. If the function's arguments contains placeholders, they will be replaced by the corresponding object fetched from this map before evaluating the function
        Returns:
        The outputs of the function. The size of the array returned should be equal to the function's declared output arity.
